intro: Ornithogalum laikipiense, commonly known as the Laikipia star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of Kenya. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its underground bulbs and tall, erect stems. The plant produces clusters of white or pale blue flowers that bloom in late winter or early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand drought conditions. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
